Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Consider increasing the value of ${JavaMaximumHeapSize}" (#1415) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. On Visual Studio for Windows, click File -> New -> Cross-Platform -> Mobile App.
2. Select the Master Detail template. Click OK.
3. Build and deploy the Android head to the Android emulator.

### Expected Behavior

App builds without issue.

### Actual Behavior

App fails to build with the following error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1091304/37375961-6828e332-26f8-11e8-95c1-9a64d9c060cd.png)

Is there any harm in setting this value to "1G" by default? It seems like if our default project templates are hitting this errors, many users are likely hitting this either at or shortly after a File -> New Project.

### Version Information

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 
Version 15.6.1
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.6.1+27428.2002

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Mono.Android-Tests] Fix #1191, add new instrumentation class for new NUnit runner" (#1413) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
* Fixes #1191 
* Adds new instrumentation for new NUnit runner.
* Fixes possible NRE in new NUnit instrumentation/runner if test inclusion/exclusion data isn't provided.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add Android P preview API." (#1380) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: It contains api-28.params.txt generated from https://github.com/xamarin/java.interop/pull/271 but it has no build-time dependency.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Invalidate Build if $(AdbTarget) changes." (#1410) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
If the `$(AdbTarget)` changes we currently do not invlaidate
the build. This can cause problems since we taylor the build
for the specific device which it attached. This happens for
FastDev builds.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build-tools] Improve logcat timing processing" (#1397) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Add another regexp match for timing log start. So far I have been
using the logcat timing with logcat output from the emulator with API
version 21. Looks like the logcat format changed in newer Android
versions.

Here is an example of the relevant part of the logcat output on Pixel
2 device (API 27):

```
03-08 15:11:48.140  1128  4745 I ActivityManager: Start proc 18503:com.xamarin.xatemplateaot/u0a241 for activity com.xamarin.xatemplateaot/md58018c7d08c228c8e2a3e03723c59ca27.MainActivity
```
While on the emulator with API 21 we see:
```
03-07 20:53:48.816  1527  1869 I ActivityManager: Start proc com.xamarin.xatemplateaot for activity com.xamarin.xatemplateaot/md58018c7d08c228c8e2a3e03723c59ca27.MainActivity: pid=3080 uid=10057 gids={50057, 9997, 3003} abi=x86
```
The main difference here for us is the location of the PID number.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request " [build] Windows support for ThirdPartyNotices" (#1398) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: #464

Since the `ThirdPartyNotices.txt` functionality was implemented in
`Makefile`, this file was not getting generated on Windows. This commit
adds the same functionality to `PrepareWindows.targets`, which basically
just builds `ThirdPartyNotices.csproj` twice with different parameters.

The only workaround I had to add for Windows was to make the
`<ProjectReference />` for `xa-prep-tasks.csproj` condition on Windows.
Otherwise, I was getting into a file-locking issue where the nested
`<MSBuild />` task was trying to copy `xa-prep-tasks.dll` to the output
directory while it was in use.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[create-vsix] Remove unnecessary cruft" (#1412) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1267

The commercial Windows `Xamarin.Android.Sdk.*.vsix` file contains lots
of files that the macOS `xamarin.android*.pkg` file does not.

Update `build-tools/create-vsix` to remove some of the additional
files which are not necessary, including:

  * `*.dylib`: macOS native libraries, not needed on Windows.
	* `$MSBuild/Xamarin/Android/**/*.pdb`: Debug symbols.
	* `$MSBuild/Xamarin/Android/lib/**/*.d.so`: Native libraries which
    have not been `strip`d.
  * `$ReferenceAssemblies/Microsoft/Framework/MonoAndroid/**/libZipSharp.*
    `libZipSharp*` is only needed in `$MSBuild`.
  * Distribute `Mono.Android.Export.*`, `OpenTK.*`, and `OpenTK-1.0.*`
    for only *one* API level, not *every* API level.
    `RedistList/FrameworkList.xml` ensures that previous framework
    versions will be included in assembly resolution via
    `/FileList/@IncludeFramework`, so there is no need to ship 10+
    identical copies of these assemblies.

A remaining (significant!) contribution to the size difference between
Windows and macOS is *documentation*: `Mono.Android.xml` is included
for each `$(TargetFrameworkVersion)`, and is ~57MB *per copy*.
This will *not* be addressed in xamarin-android, as documentation is
handled elsewhere (and I'm not entirely sure how to handle it).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Listview displays cells with different heights differently on iOS and Android" (#2093) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
Not sure if this is by design or a bug. The sample app has a listview, and the cell height is set with a random number. On iOS when you set ListViewCachingStrategy to RecycleElement, it sets the height of all the cells the same. While on Android it sets the height correctly.

### Steps to Reproduce

Run app
Note that on iOS the cells all have the same height, and that on Android the cells have different heights
Change ListViewCachingStrategy to RetainElement, run app
Note that on iOS the cells have different heights, and that on Android the cells have different heights 

### Expected Behavior
Both platforms display the cells the same

### Actual Behavior
On iOS the cells only display the cells with different heights if you set ListViewCachingStrategy to RetainElement

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.280555
- Last known good version: N/A
- IDE: VS2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  yes
  - Android: yes
  - UWP:  not tested
- Android Support Library Version: 25
- Nuget Packages: just forms
- Affected Devices: tested on Nexus 5x running Android 8 and iPhone 5s simulator running iOS 9.3

### Screenshots
https://imgur.com/a/RBfXb

### Reproduction Link
https://www.dropbox.com/s/dzjlxkfqavpfq7r/listviewscrollsample.zip?dl=0

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[macOS] Alternate picker.  Changed native control to NSPopupButton." (#1831) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Changed the native control in macOS's Picker to the NSPopUpButton from the NSComboBox.

### Bugs Fixed ###

fixes #1610

### API Changes ###

None.

### Behavioral Changes ###

The popup on the control will now size to the elements in the list no longer ellipsising the items.  It also allows for the control to be clicked over the entirety of the control rather than just the drop down button.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "HttpClient implementation warning appears when it is not needed" (#3740) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
From: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/213524/httpclient-implementation-warning-appears-when-it.html

### Steps to Reproduce

This message appears after the project is built:

Warning XIA0006: We recommend using the native HttpClient handler instead of the managed one for better performance, smaller executable size, and to easily support the newer standards. Double click on your iOS project, go to Build > iOS Build and change the HttpClient implementation to either NSUrlSession (iOS 7+) or CFNetwork to support version preceding iOS 7. (XIA0006)

but the project is already using the NSUrlSession option. Please see the attached screenshots.

![24686-httpclient-setting](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/204671/37375191-2a9a49fc-26e4-11e8-9e84-091f8d4f888d.png)

![24685-httpclient-warning](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/204671/37375199-2f181fae-26e4-11e8-9c3b-76b90f4db376.png)

### Expected Behavior
No Warning XIA0006

### Actual Behavior
Warning XIA0006

Events.RelatedBody:
- Make a second attempt at https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/commit/d5b50765f5997f3bf23f8cea8fda3c0733b1e7bc
- Fixes https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3608
- This time with the knowledge that "default" binding project templates have tag structure unlike "normal" XM project, so let's default correctly.
